speaker: KENT
text_entry: SCENE III. A wood.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter EDGAR

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I heard myself proclaim'd;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And by the happy hollow of a tree

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Escaped the hunt. No port is free; no place,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That guard, and most unusual vigilance,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Does not attend my taking. Whiles I may 'scape,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I will preserve myself: and am bethought

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: To take the basest and most poorest shape

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That ever penury, in contempt of man,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Brought near to beast: my face I'll grime with filth;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Blanket my loins: elf all my hair in knots;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And with presented nakedness out-face

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The winds and persecutions of the sky.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: The country gives me proof and precedent

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Of Bedlam beggars, who, with roaring voices,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Strike in their numb'd and mortified bare arms

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Pins, wooden pricks, nails, sprigs of rosemary;

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And with this horrible object, from low farms,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Poor pelting villages, sheep-cotes, and mills,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Sometime with lunatic bans, sometime with prayers,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Enforce their charity. Poor Turlygod! poor Tom!

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: That's something yet: Edgar I nothing am.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Exit
